newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Austria govt budget deficit seen 2.3 pct GDP in 99.
newsitem.headline: Austria govt budget deficit seen 2.3 pct GDP in 99.

text.p: Austria's new Finance Minister Rudolf Edlinger said he aimed to trim central government's budget deficit to 2.3 percent of GDP in 1999.
Edlinger told Reuters in an interview the government budget deficit should reach 2.7 percent of GDP this year and narrow to 2.5 percent in 1998.
"It is our aim to keep the overall budget deficit well within Maastricht limits in the future," he said.

He reiterated that Austria's overall budget deficit in 1996 stood at 4.0-4.1 percent of GDP. The overall budget deficit in 1997, including regional government, would not exceed 3.0 percent of GDP, he added.
